title: Cold Green Bean Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette Recipe
description: A simple cold green bean salad tossed in lemon vinaigrette with goat cheese and almonds.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Vegetable Salad Recipes Green Bean Salad Recipes Cold Green Bean Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette 4.7 (3) 1 Review 1 Photo This fresh and light salad will have everybody reaching for seconds. For variation, try some feta cheese for the goat cheese, and substitute roasted pine nuts for the almonds. Submitted by lutzflcat Updated on January 22, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 3 mins Total Time: 18 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ice as needed 1 pound fresh green beans, trimmed Vinaigrette: 1 ½ tablespoons olive oil 1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard zest of 1/2 lemon salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste 1 pinch sugar, or more to taste Garnish: 2 ounces soft goat cheese, crumbled ¼ cup toasted sliced almonds Directions Make an ice bath by filling a large bowl with ice water, and set aside. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, add green beans, and blanch until just tender-crisp, 3 to 4 minutes (do not overcook). Drain green beans, and immediately add to ice bath to stop cooking; set aside. Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon, lemon zest, salt, pepper, and a pinch of sugar together in a small bowl. Drain green beans well and pat dry with a paper towel to avoid diluting the dressing. Place into a bowl and drizzle with vinaigrette, tossing gently to coat. Transfer tossed green beans to a serving dish. Garnish with goat cheese and almonds. name: lutzflcat
instructions: Make an ice bath by filling a large bowl with ice water, and set aside.;Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, add green beans, and blanch until just tender-crisp, 3 to 4 minutes (do not overcook). Drain green beans, and immediately add to ice bath to stop cooking; set aside.;Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon, lemon zest, salt, pepper, and a pinch of sugar together in a small bowl.;Drain green beans well and pat dry with a paper towel to avoid diluting the dressing. Place into a bowl and drizzle with vinaigrette, tossing gently to coat.;Transfer tossed green beans to a serving dish. Garnish with goat cheese and almonds.
